snippet: Banks sitting on a pile of real estate assets are beginning to slash prices, eager to get out of the business of being landlords.
abstract: Spanish banks, which have been sitting on a pile of real estate assets or listing them at only slight discounts, are beginning to slash prices, eager to get out of the business of being landlords; critics fear they are simply repeating mistakes of the past by handing out 100 percent mortgages again; but giddy Spaniards, those who still have jobs, are lining up to get in on the bargains.
lead_paragraph: Banks sitting on a pile of real estate assets are beginning to slash prices, eager to get out of the business of being landlords.

headline.seo: Spaniards Grab Deals in Bank Sell-Off of Homes
headline.main: In Spain’s Housing Bust, Sell-Off Brings Bargains
headline.print_headline: In Spain’s Housing Bust, Sell-Off Brings Bargains
